greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Length of the smallest (i.e., rightmost) Lyndon word in the Lyndon factorization of the binary representation of n.
comment: The length of the largest (or leftmost) Lyndon word in the factorization is always 1.
link: N. J. A. Sloane, Maple programs
formula: a(2k) = 1 always (the only Lyndon word ending in 0 is 0 itself).
example: n=25 has binary expansion 11001, which has Lyndon factorization (1)(1)(001) with three factors. The rightmost factor, 001, has length 3, so a(25)=3.
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Mar 31 2012
